column4: can someone help with a reliable terminal command to make a mountable readonly image (iso) of a directory on a usb filesystem?
well i'm having trouble with tar on this directory, so i wanted to try something else.
meanwhile all the other dirs worked fine with tar
no, i need to CREATE the ISO from the dir on the usb
i was able to use tar on the rest of the dirs from that usb, but this one gives errors.
i am upgrading virtualbox but the 4.2 version warns that it breaks the 4.1 version.  so i'm guessing i need to uninstall first?
you can use apt-get to purge/remove/uninstall installed packages
oh, i didn't realize apt worked with .deb packages
virtualbox comes via .deb packages from their website.
if your .deb packages has been installed, you can manage it with apt
the version in the repositories is not the same version, it has limitations
ok, i'll try to remove 4.1 with apt, thank you
you should do it carefully when you using third party repository
